graph_title: Percentage of population in poverty in North West, by age

indicator_name: Proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 1: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 1.2: By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 1.2.2: Proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions
SDG_CUSTODIAN_AGENCIES__GLOBAL: United Nations Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF), World Bank (WB), United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
STAT_CONC_DEF__GLOBAL: Before Housing Costs figures count the number of individuals in poverty based on their household income before deducting housing costs; After Housing Costs figures are based on household income after deducting housing costs.
REC_USE_LIM__GLOBAL: This indicator is being used as an approximation of the UN SDG Indicator. Where possible, we will work to identify or develop UK data to meet the global indicator specification. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
SDG_GOAL: Goal 1: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
SDG_TARGET: Target 1.2: By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 1.2.2: Proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions
STAT_CONC_DEF:
The percentage of people who are living in households which are deemed at risk of poverty in the national context. Monitoring national poverty is important for country-specific development agendas. National poverty lines are used to make more accurate estimates of poverty consistent with the country’s specific economic and social circumstances, and are not intended for international comparisons of poverty rates.

Before Housing Costs figures count the number of individuals in poverty based on their household income before deducting housing costs; After Housing Costs figures are based on household income after deducting housing costs.
REC_USE_LIM:
Due to disaggregation not available at the local level, this data represents the North West of England as opposed to Liverpool. Data is based on three year averages.

This indicator is being used as an approximation of the UN SDG Indicator. Where possible, we will work to identify or develop UK data to meet the global indicator specification. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
